abstract: By absorbing Yahoo’s search business, Microsoft can increase the money it makes from search. But that doesn’t necessarily mean that Google’s revenue will decline.
snippet: By absorbing Yahoo’s search business, Microsoft can increase the money it makes from search. But that doesn’t necessarily mean that Google’s revenue will decline.
lead_paragraph: The Microsoft-Yahoo deal announced Wednesday is likely to help Microsoft much more than it will hurt Google. And for Yahoo, it’s a mixed blessing.

headline.main: In Search, Microsoft’s Gain Is Not Google’s Loss

abstract: Steve Ballmer may have failed in its quest to buy Yahoo, but his company, Microsoft, is no slouch in the deal department. Dealogic looks at the most acquisitive tech companies since 2001.
snippet: Steve Ballmer may have failed in its quest to buy Yahoo, but his company, Microsoft, is no slouch in the deal department. Dealogic looks at the most acquisitive tech companies since 2001.
lead_paragraph: Steve Ballmer failed in his quest to buy Yahoo, settling for Wednesday’s Web search deal instead. But the chief executive of Microsoft is no slouch in the deal department.

abstract: People just don’t get it, says Microsoft’s chief executive: The search deal with Yahoo is great for both companies, Apple is a “rounding error” and Microsoft is still a popular employer with college graduates.
snippet: People just don’t get it, says Microsoft’s chief executive: The search deal with Yahoo is great for both companies, Apple is a “rounding error” and Microsoft is still a popular employer with college graduates.
lead_paragraph: Yahoo’s stock price is down about 16 percent since it announced its deal Wednesday morning to turn over its Web search operations to Microsoft in exchange for an 88 percent cut of the advertising revenue.

headline.main: Yahoo Got a Great Deal, Says Microsoft’s Ballmer

abstract: Microsoft’s chief executive Steven A. Ballmer says investors failed to understand the long-term ramifications of the partnership that will unite the companies against Google.
snippet: Microsoft’s chief executive Steven A. Ballmer says investors failed to understand the long-term ramifications of the partnership that will unite the companies against Google.
lead_paragraph: REDMOND, Wash.  For 18 months, investors dissected every possible angle of a potential search and advertising deal between Microsoft and Yahoo.

headline.main: Microsoft Chief Defends Deal With Yahoo
headline.print_headline: Ballmer Defends the Deal With Yahoo
